timeline:
{
"1949-1954":"studying at the Russian department of the philological department of the Taras Shevchenko KSU, then graduating from the graduate school",
"1955":"passing the candidate minimum exam, beginning and writing a thesis about the 1863 uprising",
"1954-1956":"work as a school teacher of Russian language and literature in the village of Lesovichi (Tarashchansky district, Kiev region",
"1956-1958":"work as a school teacher in Orsha",
"1958-1962":"passing and graduating from the Higher literary and scenario courses at the Institute of Cinematography in Moscow"
}

"description":"Belarusian Soviet writer, poet, playwright, scriptwriter and publicist, classic of Belarusian literature. He is one of the most prominent figures in Belarusian literature of the 20th century. He became the first Belarusian writer to turn to the genre of historical detective."
